channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The move out of Germany represents a remarkable rebuke to one of the closest US military allies and trading partners.
item.title: 'We don't want to be the suckers': US to withdraw 12,000 troops from Germany

item.description: Congressman Louie Gohmert, who steadfastly refused to wear a mask during the coronavirus pandemic, has tested positive for COVID-19.
item.title: Mask-shunning Republican congressman tests positive for COVID-19

item.description: The number of US deaths is higher than in any other country and represents nearly a quarter of the world's total number of deaths from the virus.
item.title: US coronavirus deaths top 150,000, nearly a quarter of the world's total

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: The chance find offers a rare opportunity to study the evolution of the galaxy even as the cluster, known as the Phoenix stream, is torn apart.
item.title: Australian scientists discover dying building block of Milky Way

item.description: A three-judge panel of Israel's Supreme Court granted a closed hearing at the request of the former Melbourne Orthodox school principal's defence team.
item.title: Latest Malka Leifer appeal in Israel heard in secret

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Research shows young people are hardest hit by Australia's unemployment crisis. Rydalmere resident Sinead Simpkins applies for between 10 and 30 jobs per week without any success.
item.title: Sinead Simpkins has three degrees but is 'ghosted' by most employers

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: A generational divide has resulted in young Australians suffering a fall in incomes since 2008, while incomes for older people have climbed.
item.title: 'Lost decade' of income growth for under 35s

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: Cody Walker’s shy nine-year-old has taught him a thing or two about showing pride in their Indigenous culture.
item.title: 'A celebration': Walker reclaims the shake-a-leg with inspiration from his son

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: The Canberra star, the only Indigenous Australian among the first-grade squad of last year's grand finalists, is not impressed with the jumper the team will wear this weekend.
item.title: 'We ticked a box': Wighton blasts Raiders' Indigenous Round jersey

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: A Northern territory couple is finally thinking about going home after having twins 10 weeks premature in the middle of a pandemic.
item.title: Twins born 10 weeks early 3000km from home in the middle of a pandemic

item.dc:creator: Pallavi Singhal
item.description: A combination of good luck and rapid contact tracing has stopped NSW's rise in community transmission of COVID-19 from exploding to Victorian levels, more than two weeks after NSW began recording double-digit daily case numbers.
item.title: 'It's just manageable': NSW's race to stay ahead of the COVID-19 outbreak

item.dc:creator: Nick Galvin
item.description: Opera Australia has postponed its eagerly awaited presentation of Richard Wagner’s The Ring, and will stage no more performances this year.
item.title: Opera Australia brings down the curtain on 2020

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: All of the greater Sydney area will be declared a COVID-19 hotspot from 1am this Saturday, as Queensland reacts to rising cases numbers in NSW,
item.title: Queensland tightens border as virus cases squeeze through the cracks

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Renewable energy will supply as much as 90 per cent of the power for Australia's main energy grid by 2035 provided critical transmission lines and other investments topping $100 billion take place.
item.title: New grid report forecasts rapid transition away from coal-fired power

item.dc:creator: Timna Jacks
item.description: When a car struck Kristy Meiselbach on a pedestrian crossing in Melbourne last year, everything changed. Fear and pain are constant reminders of what she has lost.
item.title: Kristy's life was taking off. Now she's afraid to cross the road alone

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Pyrmont is becoming more likely as a site for a new train station as part of plans for larger scale development in the inner city suburb.
item.title: Inner Sydney suburb firms as location for new metro train station

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: A human rights lawyer says the fatal shooting of an Aboriginal escapee who was reportedly handcuffed and shackled shows the need to changes rules about when it's acceptable to allow guards to open fire.
item.title: Firearms rules for prison guards must be curbed, lawyer says

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Thursday, July 30

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, July 30

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Ambitious targets to improve the lives of Indigenous Australians by lifting school attendance, employment rates and university enrolments while dramatically lowering the number of children in out-of-home care and behind bars will be unveiled on Thursday.
item.title: 'Quantum shift': Ambitious new targets to improve Indigenous lives

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: Sydney-based investment company Caledonia has taken a big bet on consumers' appetite for streaming music.
item.title: Investment firm Caledonia adds Warner Music to its playlist

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Magellan Financial Group boss Hamish Douglass says excessive regulation of the US tech titans could boost China's hopes of dominating the global technology race.
item.title: Breaking up 'big tech' a big ask, says Magellan boss

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: As new research finds seniors have had the least contact with loved ones during the pandemic, one grandmother has an important message.
item.title: Older Australians most isolated during COVID-19. But 'YouTube Nanna' offers hope

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: The leader of the Catholic church in Sydney has blasted the state government for its failure to enact laws against forced and unpaid labour.
item.title: Catholic Archbishop slams failure to act on slavery as a 'disgrace'

item.dc:creator: Greg Mullins
item.description: A summit was convened by 33 retired fire and emergency chiefs. We have an ambitious plan to confront a monstrous threat.
item.title: The verdict from bushfire experts: there's no sidestepping climate

item.dc:creator: John Hewson
item.description: The nation has an opportunity to live up to its claims of egalitarianism.
item.title: Advance Australia fair? To recover from COVID, reset social policy

item.description: There’s no way around the uncomfortable, sometimes cringing, moment when a discussion about services reaches the money bit.
item.title: Take the charge out of creative negotiating

item.description: The Treasurer's latest offering of wanting to channel Thatcher and Reagan shows the nature of conservative politicians – back to the old days.
item.title: Best we leave fossils in the past to earn a better future

item.description: A former member of the national women's rugby league team calls on fellow Australians to join her campaign.
item.title: Show us which team you're on: help the NRL tackle racism

item.dc:creator: Harry Hollinsworth
item.description: The tea-makers dispute at Newcastle steelworks boiled over again today.
item.title: In the Herald: July 30, 1969

item.description: On July 30, 1985, popular presenter Huw Evans quit the ABC and voiced concern over the future of the national broadcaster.
item.title: From the Archives, 1985: Huw Evans to quit ABC after 14 years

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 30, 2020

item.dc:creator: Malcolm Knox
item.description: Super Netball's return is a testament to the determination and organisation of all involved and, fingers crossed, the season will proceed to its conclusion.
item.title: Moving forward, let's keep netball offence on the court

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Carlos D Miguel, general manager of the Rinehart-backed Hanrine Ecuadoran Exploration and Mining, was detained on Monday in Tumbaco.
item.title: Rinehart's Ecuadorian GM is not strapped for cache

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: Six resident arts companies based at Carriageworks have shared in long-term funding totalling almost $5 million.
item.title: Carriageworks companies offered lifeline

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: The government's advisory body also wants mandated quotes for Australian-made goods when governments are making purchases in big-spending areas like defence.
item.title: Manufacturing shake-up to drive jobs boom: COVID taskforce

item.dc:creator: Martin Boulton
item.description: Paul Kelly and Paul Gabrowsky deliver an album of reimagined torch songs.
item.title: Old favourites illuminated

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews says a DHHS decision to send home all St Basil's staff and management was necessarily, but Dr Brendan Murphy says it won't happen again.
item.title: Victoria's 'guarantee': St Basil's aged care centre debacle will not happen again

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: NAB will replace face-to-face interactions with phone and online services
item.title: NAB to slash operating hours at dozens of regional branches

item.dc:creator: Tom Switzer
item.description: The hostility of Frydenberg’s critics leaves one wondering whether his remarks have touched the exposed nerve of a new economic nationalism - or even socialism - in Australia.
item.title: Is Josh Frydenberg so wrong to invoke Thatcher and Reagan?

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: Aged-care experts, health workers and community activists say Victoria’s aged-care crisis was a human tragedy waiting to happen.
item.title: Aged-care crisis was 'utterly predictable'

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: Victorian paramedics have been issued with vented masks that could potentially place patients at risk of catching coronavirus.
item.title: 'Dumbfounded': Paramedics wearing masks that could spread COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: Health department documents reveal a team central to the pandemic fight was the worst resourced in the country, as insiders claim antiquated contact tracing systems and inexperienced staff hampered efforts to control coronavirus.
item.title: Top bureaucrats warned a year ago Victoria's key public health team was starved of money and staff

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: Boris has changed his mind, and it’s time our policymakers did too.
item.title: Walk for the dole? We must find new ways to tackle those corona kilos

item.dc:creator: Stephen Duckett
item.description: It has been clear for months that residential aged care should have been the number one priority for reducing deaths from COVID-19.
item.title: Aged care deaths should have been prevented

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: Richmond and Carlton are set to be handed hefty fines by the AFL for COVID-19 breaches in Queensland.
item.title: Clubs being investigated for COVID protocol breaches as AFL takes tough stance on hub life

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: "Karen", once mainly an American Twitter slur, is fast becoming a potent put-down for any woman over 25 raising her voice in Australia.
item.title: Play the individual, not the Karen

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: Richmond coach Damien Hardwick reserved praise for defender Noah Balta who was among his side's best in their win over the Bulldogs.
item.title: Balta from the blue: Have the Tigers found their new Alex Rance?

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Brisbane Roar saw off Melbourne Victory 2-1 to set up their finals charge, but Victory's management can be pleased with the performance of their youngsters.
item.title: Roar get three points in 2-1 win but Victory's kids go down fighting

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: In last night’s opening minutes Jack Riewoldt shoved the pack under the ball, took a mark and kicked a goal. In ordinary times this is not remarkable. These are not ordinary times.
item.title: Richmond rediscover those Tigers of old
